data.title: Lunch
data.text:
very traditional Thai food, tasty, yummy and fair price!
The Thai tea is too sweet, but the taste is very transitional Thai style!
Service is very good!
Recommend come to here for whatever the lunch or dinner

data.title: excellent thai food
data.text: you can't go wrong if your choice is thai food! excellent food. never been disappointed! the staff provides excellent service and the chef is superb!

data.title: No Other Thai Restaurant Can Compare
data.text: We Love This Place! It's a quaint, delicious, Thai food Oasis! The menu is great; you pick your dish, then add meat, tofu or vegetables, you pick how spicy you want it...always comes out just right. I have tried a number of things on the menu, and is all good, but the PadThai is just Fantastic!! We Love to start our Girls Night Out here. It's a little hard to find, on a side street, but you'll be so glad you came. And, it's great for take out! Big portions, too.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Consistently good fresh food made to order. If I could say anything is that I wish the price point was a few dollars less for entrees. Otherwise I have no complaints. The staff is always friendly and the food is always great.

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text: Not really hidden, if your a local you know where it is,  GPS it if your not. Definitely worth the trip, wonderful food, and service. i would have to agree its one the top restaurants in Daytona Beach.  i just recently discovered it, and now its my favorite lunch destination, especially if you like spicy food .

data.title: Wonderful outside atmosphere
data.text: Service could use a little help.  Food is presented well and good tasting.  Outside dining is a joy. Wine selection okay.

data.title: Worth The Trip Away From The Beach
data.text: This place is in the downtown area of Daytona just off the main road. A nice quiet place to have dinner. We both had the curry entrees that were very good. The portions were good and prices were also good. Our server Hannah took good care of us and made our dinner great.

data.title: Top restaurants of Daytona
data.text: One of the top restaurants of Daytona and I'm very surprised it's not rated much better.  Every visit everything is cooked and sauced to perfection and the courtyard is amazing and the staff is very accompanying.  If you have never tried the Thai ice tea or Thai rolls they are a must have and I've tried about half the entrees and every time I have enjoyed.

data.title: THE BEST PLACE IN DAYTONA
data.text: This Thai food restaurant is so good, it is unreal. The atmosphere is romantic and great for dates. The staff is really nice and  courteous. The food is divine and really great price for the size and taste. I went to Zappis the day before and got twice the food for half the price and twice the taste. I would pay top dollar for the food and atmosphere.

data.title: What a surprise
data.text:
Came to Zen Bistro with a work outing for lunch. I've never had Tai food before. Thank goodness the menu was very descriptive.  When you order you can tell them how spicy you want it. 

I had fried tofu as a starter (could have been cooked a little longer) but the sauce that comes with it is so good. I ended up putting the extra on my meal.  I had the sautéed veggies and added chicken. It was DELISH. The veggies were cooked perfectly. 

All dishes are cooked to order, so being in a large group I was impressed that our food came out together and was hot and fresh. 

I noticed the to go orders piling up.  I'll be back to try the curry.

data.title: Love the food
data.text: They were even better before they moved to this bigger place, but they are still pretty good. It is for those who loves spicy food like I do. Used to come here often, now not as often and I miss the place

data.title: A gem in tve middle of Daytona
data.text: Great restaurant!!! The people are super friendly and the food is phenomenal😊😊😊. Thai hot is the best. This place is a gem. Super atmosphere.

data.title: Incongruous pairing with a baseball game, but great!
data.text:
The food at the minor league ballpark in Daytona Beach (the Daytona Tortugas) is meh, so we try to find new and interesting restaurants before each game.  When we saw Zen Bistro was voted best Thai food in Daytona Beach, we were convinced to give it a try -- and what a find!

We had chicken satay, a favorite of my husband's, and green papaya salad, a favorite of mine.  We decided to split an entree since we knew we wouldn't be able to leave any leftovers in the car during the game. We ordered chicken in garlic sauce.  It was served over a bed of perfectly steamed broccoli with rice.   When we said we were sharing, they brought us each a plate with our own portion of rice at no extra charge.  Very nice touch.

The rest of the menu looked equally appetizing, and we had trouble deciding on an entree.  We will have to go back!

data.title: Good food, good ambience
data.text: Place is kind of hidden, but it is definitely worth finding. Went once for lunch with colleagues, we chose to be seated outside. I found the food to be good, the service good, and the overall ambience good. I would try them again.

data.title: Great Find! Superb Service
data.text: Can't say enough good things about this place. Personally recommend the Wai Wai Noodles for an entree and Goyza for a starter. Atmosphere was great and service was amazing. Ask for Macy and you won't be disappointed. Definitely recommend this place, you won't be disappointed!

data.title: Okay Food and Wonderful Friendship = Excellent Evening
data.text:
We had a great dinner tonight because we were in the great company of Jerry and Esther; its wonderful every time we have our occasional get together.

Now, back to Zen Bistro...I've never been to their old location; but from what I heard this new location is much more wonderful when it comes to ambience--yes, the place exudes ambience, lots of it. If not for the rain we would have been outside the restaurant--enjoying the sea breeze; indulging ourselves with exotic food.

The staff is wonderful, helpful, and very professional. Zen Bistro has a wonderful staff--very accommodating and courteous. The food was okay; it was not great. We ordered five different food: shrimp in a basket, couple of soup, pad thai, fried rice, and pineapple fried rice. Shrimp was wrapped in wonton and then fried--IMHO, the shrimp was bland and it should have been marinated before frying. Pad Thai was okay; I had better Pad Thai before. Both fried rice had no taste difference; the only difference was the pieces of pineapple. Portions was fair; one order of fried rice was usually good for two people. Prices are standard $$.

RECOMMENDATION: Since there are only few Thai restaurants in the area and most probably they are all the same, I would still come back to Zen Bistro because of their excellent staff. IMHO--lots of improvement to make on their cooking and taste; its not all about presentation...

data.title: It looks tiny but there is plenty of room.
data.text: We dined outdoors and luckily had great weather. I had mild Thai that was delicious. Price was pretty good for what we had and we ended up with leftovers.

data.title: Great place for outdoor lunch
data.text: Recently I met two friends for lunch on a beautiful but warm day.  The outdoor seating has just enough shade to cut the heat of the noon sun and the food as usual was fresh, tasty with some heat of its own.  Great place to have a cold draft with your excellent Thai food.  We had a curry a noodle dish and a papaya salad.  Great place for downtown eating.

data.title: Great Thai
data.text: I went traditional with Pad Thai, chicken.  I asked for it hot and it was perfect.  It as the burning but gave me the sniffles.  They used Thai paste which is my preference.  Nice fresh dish, good size portion.  I went for lunch and they had a good crowd.  If you like Thai, this is a must stop.  Traditional menu of Curr, noodles or rice.  Plus a Kile twist, pumpkin curry sounded unique.  Lots of locals, I met couple next to me who go every week.

data.title: Great Thai Food!
data.text: I visited here with my wife and son. We all enjoy Thai food. I ordered the Medium spicy (which is spicy) vegetable and beef and it was delicious!! However to me there seemed to be a sweetener added to the sauce to please the typical american taste buds, which is why I can not give it a 5 star. Everything else was great!!
